docs.title: Rake Up Eagle
docs.text:
Rake Up Eagle connects volunteer teams with seniors, veterans, and disabled citizens in a day of public service.

This year's event takes place on November 15 -- join today as a recipient or volunteer your team!

docs.title: Volunteer to Help
docs.text:
Signup your team to rake the yard of a senior, veteran, or disabled neighbor!

Sign Up!

docs.title: Register to be Raked
docs.text:
If you're a senior, veteran, or disabled Eagle resident, register to have your yard raked!

Register!

docs.title: About
docs.text: Rake Up Eagle is an initiative of the Eagle Middle School PTO. Inspired by Rake Up Boise, our goal is to connect volunteers with seniors, veterans, and disabled Eagle residents to rake and clean yards.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Below find answers to some frequently asked questions for Recipients and Teams.

docs.title: Recipient FAQ
Who qualifies to have their yard raked?
docs.text: Recipients must be 65 years or older, disabled or a veteran and live in Eagle. Note: If you live in Meridian, please contact Rake Up Meridian at (208) 685-7748 or kmcdannel@republicservices.com; for Boise, contact Rake Up Boise, 208-258-6222 or email rakeupboise@nwboise.org.

docs.title: How do I apply to have my yard raked?
docs.text: Find the application form and additional information on our Recipient Page.

docs.title: My yard was raked last year. Do I need to send in another application?
docs.text: Yes, please sign up again. You must apply every year to have your yard raked.

docs.title: When will I know that my house has been chosen to be raked?
docs.text: All recipients will be called within a week of the event date to confirm your yard was chosen.

docs.title: Will I need to be home when the team comes to rake my yard?
docs.text: No, you don't have to be home. Please confine your animal, make sure all animal waste is cleaned up and keep the gate unlocked so they can rake.

docs.title: I have a dog/cat, what should I do with it during Rake Up Eagle?
docs.text: Please confine your animal during the time that the team is at your home. Also, make sure all animal waste is picked up. If there is animal waste in the yard, the team will not rake your yard.

docs.title: What if the team comes before all of my leaves fall?
docs.text: Rake Up Eagle is a single-day event, so you'll need to make other arrangements for late-falling leaves.

docs.title: Can a team rake on a different day?
docs.text: Our teams will rake on November 15. If there is inclement weather on that date, we'll do our best to schedule for a later time.

docs.title: What supplies does Rake Up Eagle supply for the volunteers?
docs.text: We provide the leaf bags. Teams bring their own rakes, gloves, etc. All filled lawn bags will go at the end of your driveway for pick up.

docs.title: Team FAQ
What supplies does Rake Up Eagle provide for volunteer teams?
docs.text: We provide the leaf bags. Teams will need to bring their own rakes, gloves, etc.

docs.title: What time is Rake Up Eagle?
docs.text: You will need to pick up your lawn bags at Eagle Middle on or before November 15 between 9-10 AM. There is no set time to begin raking; most teams rake in the morning.

docs.title: Does my entire team sign up on the website?
docs.text: No, only the team leader should sign up on the website. This person then serves as the coordinator for all of the team members.

docs.title: When will the teams receive their assigned houses?
docs.text: If you request a specific recipient we'll try to arrange for that in advance. Otherwise, a recipient will be assigned when you pick up your bags.

docs.title: Can teams rake on a different day?
docs.text: We have committed to raking on November 15, and only will reschedule due to inclement weather.

docs.title: What should we do if we run out of bags?
docs.text: Please go to EMS and ask for more or text us and we will have some delivered.

docs.title: What should we do with the leftover bags?
docs.text: Please return all unused bags to Eagle Middle school, 1000 W Floating Feather Rd.

docs.title: What if the yard has dog/cat waste in it?
docs.text: You are not allowed to rake if there is animal waste in the yard. The homeowners have been notified they need to clean up all animal waste before teams show up.

docs.title: What do we do if it rains/snows on or before Rake Up Eagle?
docs.text:
We ask that all teams get the raking done as soon as possible, preferably within a week of November 15. If you absolutely cannot reschedule, please contact Rake Up Eagle to reassign the yard. Please also watch for texts from Rake Up Eagle PTO with instructions if weather becomes an issue.

Still have questions? Ask us at eaglemiddlepto@gmail.com!

docs.title: Recipient
To qualify for Rake Up Eagle, registrants must:
docs.text:
• Be at least 65 years old, disabled or a veteran
  • Live within the city limits of Eagle
  • Reside at the stated residence
  • Agree to our terms and waiver

Our volunteers will arrive on November 15th between 9 - 11AM. They will bring all their own equipment, rake your leaves into bags, and place them at your normal pickup location.

If you have a dog/cat they must be inside during the rake, and all animal waste must be picked up prior to raking. If there is animal waste in the yard our volunteers will leave and not reschedule.

To register, please CLICK HERE.

docs.title: Support
docs.text: If you require support, please send an email to support@rakeupeagle.com and we'll do everything we can to help!

docs.title: Terms and Waiver
docs.text:
To participate in Rake Up Eagle as either a Recipient or Team you must agree to the following terms and waiver:

"I agree to waive and release Rake Up Eagle and the sponsors of this event, including all persons and agencies connected with this event, from all claims for damages, injuries or death arising from my participation in this event as a team. I will provide my own insurance and care, if necessary. I also understand and agree that Rake Up Eagle or sponsors may subsequently use for publicity and/or promotional purposes pictures of me and my team participating in this event without obligation of liability to me. I understand that as a recipient the work done on my property is performed by volunteers and will not hold them or Rake Up Eagle responsible for damage to personal property."

docs.title: Volunteer
Thanks for being willing to help!  Here's what you need to know:
docs.text:
• The event date is November 15th.
  • Check-in takes place from 9-10 AM at Eagle Middle School, 1000 W Floating Feather Rd, Eagle, ID 83616.
  • We provide the lawn bags; you need to bring rakes, gloves, etc.
  • You agree to our terms and waiver.

To sign up, please CLICK HERE.
